page.title: 01Summary of the Area
page.content: The survey area includes Aldrington, West Blatchington & Hangleton in Hove, Southwick,Portslade-by-sea & Mile Oak situated on the coastal plain at the foot of the dip slope of the South Downs overlooking the English Channel. Relief ranges from 15 to 100 metres above sea level with the highest point of 325 metres on the downs.Geology is basically chalk but also some coombe rock and brickearth. Most development took place from 1925 & most areas are residential with some open spaces such as a golf course. There is little space for development apart from the farmland in the valleys of Mile Oak, Hangleton & North Portslade.Brighton has an important role for the area for people travel east for entertainment,shopping & work.A coastal railway & A27 road cross the region.Climate is mild.
